summary: This document is an exhibit from a civil case (9:08-cv-80736-KAM) containing an email exchange and a draft plea proffer related to Jeffrey Epstein's 2007 criminal investigation. The email discusses legal strategy to minimize press coverage, and the attached proffer details an incident where Epstein obstructed an FBI investigation by instructing his assistant not to cooperate and by redirecting his flight to avoid service of target letters.

events.title: FBI Agents Visit Assistant's Home
events.description: FBI Special Agents E. Nesbitt Kuyrkendall and Jason Richards traveled to the home of Jeffrey Epstein's personal assistant to serve her with a subpoena.

events.title: Epstein's In-Flight Obstruction
events.description: While aboard his private aircraft in the Southern District of Florida, Jeffrey Epstein called his assistant, instructed her not to speak with FBI agents, and then redirected his flight to the U.S. Virgin Islands to avoid being served with target letters.

events.title: Alleged Assault on Aircraft
events.description: During the same flight, while in U.S. airspace, Epstein became verbally abusive and threatening towards a female companion, causing her to reasonably fear an offensive touching.

keyFacts: The document reveals a strategy by Epstein's legal team to file charges in Miami to 'cut the press coverage significantly'.
A draft plea proffer details an incident where Epstein obstructed a federal investigation by instructing his assistant not to cooperate with FBI agents and by diverting his private flight.
The proffer alleges an assault charge could be based on 49 USC 46506, as any assault aboard a civil aircraft in flight falls under U.S. special aircraft jurisdiction.
The document indicates Epstein was aboard his private airplane in the Southern District of Florida in August 2007 when he learned of the FBI's visit to his assistant.
The proffer describes an incident where Epstein became verbally abusive and threatening towards a female companion during the flight, constituting an alleged assault.
